Python Code python
import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import os import time from urllib.parse import quote_plus print('=== HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH INFORMATION SEARCH ===') print('Searching for death date, obituary, and cause of death for Harry Schwarz') print('Target: Harry Schwarz - South African politician, ambassador to France') print('Focus: Death information, obituary, cause of death\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = 'workspace' if not os.path.exists(workspace_dir): os.makedirs(workspace_dir) print(f'Created workspace directory: {workspace_dir}') # Initialize search tracking search_results = { 'timestamp': '2025-01-07', 'target_person': 'Harry Schwarz', 'objective': 'Find death date, obituary, and cause of death', 'search_queries': [], 'results_collected': [], 'files_saved': [] } # Define comprehensive search queries for Harry Schwarz death information search_queries = [ 'Harry Schwarz South Africa death cause obituary', 'Harry Schwarz Progressive Federal Party died death', 'Harry Schwarz ambassador France death 2010', 'Harry Schwarz obituary South African politician', 'Harry Schwarz death date cause Progressive Party', 'Harry Schwarz Inkatha Freedom Party died when', 'Harry Schwarz South African ambassador obituary', 'Harry Schwarz death 2010 cause Progressive Federal' ] print(f'üìã PLANNED SEARCH QUERIES ({len(search_queries)} total):') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i}. {query}') # Execute searches using DuckDuckGo print('\nüîç EXECUTING SEARCHES:') print('=' * 60) for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'\nSearch {i}/{len(search_queries)}: {query}') print('-' * 50) try: # Prepare search URL for DuckDuckGo encoded_query = quote_plus(query) search_url = f'https://duckduckgo.com/html/?q={encoded_query}' # Set headers to mimic a real browser headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } print(f'Searching: {search_url}') # Make the search request response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) response.raise_for_status() print(f'‚úÖ Response received: {response.status_code}') print(f' Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') print(f' Content type: {response.headers.get("content-type", "unknown")}') # Parse the HTML response soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Extract search results result_links = soup.find_all('a', {'class': 'result__a'}) result_snippets = soup.find_all('a', {'class': 'result__snippet'}) print(f' Search result links found: {len(result_links)}') print(f' Search result snippets found: {len(result_snippets)}') # Save the HTML response filename = f'harry_schwarz_search_{i:02d}_{query.replace(" ", "_")[:30]}.html' filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'üíæ Search results saved to: {filename}') # Extract text content for analysis page_text = soup.get_text(separator=' ', strip=True) # Look for Harry Schwarz mentions harry_schwarz_mentions = { 'harry schwarz': page_text.lower().count('harry schwarz'), 'schwarz': page_text.lower().count('schwarz'), 'progressive federal party': page_text.lower().count('progressive federal party'), 'ambassador': page_text.lower().count('ambassador') } total_mentions = sum(harry_schwarz_mentions.values()) print(f' Harry Schwarz mentions: {harry_schwarz_mentions} (Total: {total_mentions})') # Look for death-related keywords death_keywords = ['death', 'died', 'obituary', 'passed away', 'demise', 'funeral', 'burial', 'cause of death'] death_mentions = {} for keyword in death_keywords: count = page_text.lower().count(keyword) if count > 0: death_mentions[keyword] = count if death_mentions: print(f' Death-related mentions: {death_mentions}') else: print(' No death-related keywords found') # Look for specific years (focusing on 2000-2025 for recent deaths) import re year_pattern = re.compile(r'\b(20[0-2]\d)\b') years_found = year_pattern.findall(page_text) if years_found: from collections import Counter year_counts = Counter(years_found) print(f' Years mentioned: {dict(year_counts.most_common(5))}') # Store search result info search_result_info = { 'query': query, 'query_number': i, 'filename': filename, 'response_status': response.status_code, 'content_length': len(response.content), 'harry_schwarz_mentions': harry_schwarz_mentions, 'total_mentions': total_mentions, 'death_mentions': death_mentions, 'years_found': list(set(years_found)) if years_found else [], 'result_links_count': len(result_links), 'result_snippets_count': len(result_snippets) } search_results['search_queries'].append(query) search_results['results_collected'].append(search_result_info) search_results['files_saved'].append(filename) # Brief pause between searches to be respectful if i < len(search_queries): print(' ‚è≥ Pausing 2 seconds before next search...') time.sleep(2) except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e: print(f'‚ùå Error with search {i}: {str(e)}') search_results['results_collected'].append({ 'query': query, 'query_number': i, 'error': str(e), 'status': 'failed' }) except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Unexpected error with search {i}: {str(e)}') search_results['results_collected'].append({ 'query': query, 'query_number': i, 'error': str(e), 'status': 'failed' }) print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH SEARCH SUMMARY') print('=' * 80) # Analyze overall results total_searches = len(search_queries) successful_searches = len([r for r in search_results['results_collected'] if 'error' not in r]) failed_searches = total_searches - successful_searches print(f'üìä SEARCH EXECUTION SUMMARY:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total searches planned: {total_searches}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Successful searches: {successful_searches}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Failed searches: {failed_searches}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Files saved: {len(search_results["files_saved"])}') # Analyze Harry Schwarz mentions across all results total_harry_schwarz_mentions = 0 total_death_mentions = 0 all_years_found = [] for result in search_results['results_collected']: if 'total_mentions' in result: total_harry_schwarz_mentions += result['total_mentions'] if 'death_mentions' in result: total_death_mentions += sum(result['death_mentions'].values()) if 'years_found' in result: all_years_found.extend(result['years_found']) print(f'\nüéØ CONTENT ANALYSIS SUMMARY:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total Harry Schwarz mentions: {total_harry_schwarz_mentions}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total death-related mentions: {total_death_mentions}') if all_years_found: from collections import Counter year_summary = Counter(all_years_found) print(f' ‚Ä¢ Years found across searches: {dict(year_summary.most_common(10))}') else: print(' ‚Ä¢ No specific years identified') # Show most promising searches print(f'\nüèÜ MOST PROMISING SEARCHES:') promising_searches = [] for result in search_results['results_collected']: if 'total_mentions' in result and result['total_mentions'] > 0: score = result['total_mentions'] if 'death_mentions' in result: score += sum(result['death_mentions'].values()) * 2 # Weight death mentions higher promising_searches.append((result, score)) # Sort by score promising_searches.sort(key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for i, (result, score) in enumerate(promising_searches[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Query: {result["query"]}') print(f' Score: {score} (Harry Schwarz mentions: {result["total_mentions"]})') if result.get('death_mentions'): print(f' Death mentions: {result["death_mentions"]}') print(f' File: {result["filename"]}') # Save comprehensive search results search_summary_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'harry_schwarz_death_search_results.json') with open(search_summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH RESULTS SAVED TO: harry_schwarz_death_search_results.json') # Next steps recommendation print(f'\nüîç NEXT STEPS RECOMMENDATION:') if successful_searches > 0: print('‚úÖ Search results collected successfully') if total_harry_schwarz_mentions > 0: print('‚úÖ Harry Schwarz content found in search results') if total_death_mentions > 0: print('‚úÖ Death-related content identified - proceed with detailed analysis') print('üîç NEXT: Analyze HTML files to extract specific death information') else: print('‚ö†Ô∏è Limited death-related content found') print('üîç NEXT: Analyze HTML files for biographical information and timeline') else: print('‚ö†Ô∏è Limited Harry Schwarz content found') print('üîç NEXT: Try more specific search terms or different sources') else: print('‚ùå No successful searches completed') print('üîç NEXT: Check internet connection or try alternative search methods') print('\n=== HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH SEARCH COMPLETE ===') print(f'Files saved in workspace: {len(search_results["files_saved"])} HTML files + 1 JSON summary') print('Ready for detailed analysis of search results')
Execution Output
Code Output: === HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH INFORMATION SEARCH === Searching for death date, obituary, and cause of death for Harry Schwarz Target: Harry Schwarz - South African politician, ambassador to France Focus: Death information, obituary, cause of death üìã PLANNED SEARCH QUERIES (8 total): 1. Harry Schwarz South Africa death cause obituary 2. Harry Schwarz Progressive Federal Party died death 3. Harry Schwarz ambassador France death 2010 4. Harry Schwarz obituary South African politician 5. Harry Schwarz death date cause Progressive Party 6. Harry Schwarz Inkatha Freedom Party died when 7. Harry Schwarz South African ambassador obituary 8. Code Execution - Plan #4 (Iteration 2)

Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from collections import Counter print('=== HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH INFORMATION ANALYSIS ===') print('Analyzing search results to extract death date, obituary, and cause of death') print('Target: Harry Schwarz - South African politician and ambassador to France\n') # First, inspect the workspace directory and available files workspace_dir = 'workspace' html_files = [] json_files = [] if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): if filename.endswith('.html') and 'harry_schwarz' in filename: html_files.append(filename) elif filename.endswith('.json') and 'harry_schwarz' in filename: json_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(html_files)} HTML files and {len(json_files)} JSON files:') for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): print(f' HTML {i}. {filename}') for i, filename in enumerate(json_files, 1): print(f' JSON {i}. {filename}') else: print('‚ùå Workspace directory not found') html_files = [] json_files = [] # First, inspect the JSON summary file structure if it exists if json_files: json_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, json_files[0]) print(f'\nüìã INSPECTING JSON SUMMARY FILE: {json_files[0]}') print('-' * 60) try: with open(json_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: json_data = json.load(f) print('JSON file structure:') for key in json_data.keys(): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {key}: {type(json_data[key])}') if isinstance(json_data[key], list): print(f' Length: {len(json_data[key])}') if len(json_data[key]) > 0 and isinstance(json_data[key][0], dict): print(f' Sample keys: {list(json_data[key][0].keys())}') print(f'\nJSON summary:') print(f' Target person: {json_data.get("target_person", "Not found")}') print(f' Objective: {json_data.get("objective", "Not found")}') print(f' Total queries: {len(json_data.get("search_queries", []))}') print(f' Results collected: {len(json_data.get("results_collected", []))}') # Show most promising results from JSON if 'results_collected' in json_data: promising_results = [r for r in json_data['results_collected'] if r.get('total_mentions', 0) > 0] print(f' Promising results: {len(promising_results)}') for result in promising_results[:2]: print(f' ‚Ä¢ Query: {result.get("query", "Unknown")}') print(f' Mentions: {result.get("total_mentions", 0)}') print(f' Death mentions: {result.get("death_mentions", {})}') print(f' File: {result.get("filename", "Unknown")}') except Exception as e: print(f'Error reading JSON file: {str(e)}') # Now analyze the HTML files for detailed death information if not html_files: print('‚ùå No HTML search result files found to analyze') else: print(f'\nüìÅ ANALYZING {len(html_files)} HTML FILES FOR HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH INFORMATION:') print('=' * 80) # Initialize detailed analysis results death_analysis = { 'timestamp': '2025-01-07', 'files_analyzed': len(html_files), 'harry_schwarz_mentions': [], 'death_information': [], 'obituary_content': [], 'biographical_data': [], 'year_mentions': [], 'potential_death_dates': [], 'cause_of_death': [] } # Focus on the two most promising files first (based on tester feedback) priority_files = [f for f in html_files if 'search_01' in f or 'search_02' in f] other_files = [f for f in html_files if f not in priority_files] analysis_order = priority_files + other_files print(f'Analysis order (priority files first): {len(priority_files)} priority, {len(other_files)} others') # Analyze each HTML file for i, filename in enumerate(analysis_order, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) is_priority = filename in priority_files priority_marker = 'üéØ PRIORITY' if is_priority else 'üìÑ STANDARD' print(f'\n{priority_marker} - Analyzing File {i}: {filename}') print('-' * 70) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() # Parse HTML with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Extract all text content page_text = soup.get_text(separator=' ', strip=True) page_text_lower = page_text.lower() print(f'HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters') print(f'Extracted text size: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Look for Harry Schwarz mentions harry_schwarz_indicators = { 'harry schwarz': page_text_lower.count('harry schwarz'), 'schwarz': page_text_lower.count('schwarz'), 'progressive federal party': page_text_lower.count('progressive federal party'), 'progressive party': page_text_lower.count('progressive party'), 'ambassador': page_text_lower.count('ambassador'), 'south africa': page_text_lower.count('south africa') } total_mentions = sum(harry_schwarz_indicators.values()) print(f'Harry Schwarz mentions: {harry_schwarz_indicators} (Total: {total_mentions})') if total_mentions > 0: print('‚úÖ Harry Schwarz content found in this file') # Split text into sentences for detailed analysis sentences = re.split(r'[.!?]', page_text) harry_schwarz_sentences = [] for sentence in sentences: if len(sentence.strip()) > 10: sentence_clean = sentence.strip() sentence_lower = sentence_clean.lower() # Check if this sentence mentions Harry Schwarz if 'harry schwarz' in sentence_lower or ('schwarz' in sentence_lower and any(term in sentence_lower for term in ['progressive', 'ambassador', 'south africa'])): harry_schwarz_sentences.append({ 'text': sentence_clean, 'text_lower': sentence_lower }) print(f'Sentences mentioning Harry Schwarz: {len(harry_schwarz_sentences)}') # Analyze for death information death_keywords = ['death', 'died', 'obituary', 'passed away', 'demise', 'deceased', 'funeral', 'burial', 'cause of death'] death_info_found = [] obituary_content = [] cause_of_death = [] for sentence_data in harry_schwarz_sentences: sentence_text = sentence_data['text'] sentence_lower = sentence_data['text_lower'] # Check for death keywords for keyword in death_keywords: if keyword in sentence_lower: death_info_found.append({ 'keyword': keyword, 'sentence': sentence_text[:400], 'context': 'harry_schwarz_sentence' }) # Special handling for obituary content if keyword == 'obituary': obituary_content.append({ 'sentence': sentence_text[:500], 'source_file': filename }) # Special handling for cause of death if 'cause' in sentence_lower and 'death' in sentence_lower: cause_of_death.append({ 'sentence': sentence_text[:500], 'source_file': filename }) break # Only count once per sentence # Look for specific death dates and years year_pattern = re.compile(r'\b(19\d{2}|20[0-2]\d)\b') years_found = year_pattern.findall(page_text) # Look for date patterns (day/month/year formats) date_patterns = [ r'\b(\d{1,2}[/-]\d{1,2}[/-]\d{4})\b', # DD/MM/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY r'\b(\d{1,2}\s+\w+\s+\d{4})\b', # DD Month YYYY r'\b(\w+\s+\d{1,2},?\s+\d{4})\b' # Month DD, YYYY ] potential_death_dates = [] for pattern in date_patterns: dates = re.findall(pattern, page_text) for date in dates: # Check if this date appears near death-related words for death_word in death_keywords[:5]: if death_word in page_text_lower: date_pos = page_text.find(date) death_positions = [m.start() for m in re.finditer(death_word, page_text_lower)] for death_pos in death_positions: distance = abs(date_pos - death_pos) if distance < 300: # Within 300 characters context_start = max(0, min(date_pos, death_pos) - 100) context_end = max(date_pos, death_pos) + 200 context = page_text[context_start:context_end] potential_death_dates.append({ 'date': date, 'death_word': death_word, 'distance': distance, 'context': context.strip(), 'source_file': filename }) # Report findings for this file if death_info_found: print(f'üíÄ Death information found: {len(death_info_found)} instances') for j, info in enumerate(death_info_found, 1): print(f' {j}. Keyword: "{info["keyword"]}"') print(f' Sentence: {info["sentence"]}...') death_analysis['death_information'].extend(death_info_found) else: print('‚ùì No death information found in Harry Schwarz sentences') if obituary_content: print(f'üì∞ Obituary content found: {len(obituary_content)} instances') for content in obituary_content: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {content["sentence"][:200]}...') death_analysis['obituary_content'].extend(obituary_content) if cause_of_death: print(f'‚öïÔ∏è Cause of death information: {len(cause_of_death)} instances') for cause in cause_of_death: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {cause["sentence"][:200]}...') death_analysis['cause_of_death'].extend(cause_of_death) if potential_death_dates: print(f'üìÖ Potential death dates found: {len(potential_death_dates)} instances') # Sort by distance (closer = more likely) potential_death_dates.sort(key=lambda x: x['distance']) for date_info in potential_death_dates[:3]: # Show top 3 print(f' ‚Ä¢ Date: {date_info["date"]} (near "{date_info["death_word"]}", distance: {date_info["distance"]} chars)') print(f' Context: {date_info["context"][:150]}...') death_analysis['potential_death_dates'].extend(potential_death_dates) if years_found: year_counts = Counter(years_found) print(f'üìÖ Years mentioned: {dict(year_counts.most_common(10))}') death_analysis['year_mentions'].extend(years_found) # Store file analysis info death_analysis['harry_schwarz_mentions'].append({ 'filename': filename, 'is_priority': is_priority, 'mentions': harry_schwarz_indicators, 'total_mentions': total_mentions, 'death_info_count': len(death_info_found), 'obituary_count': len(obituary_content), 'cause_of_death_count': len(cause_of_death), 'potential_dates_count': len(potential_death_dates), 'years_found': len(years_found), 'harry_schwarz_sentences': len(harry_schwarz_sentences) }) else: print('‚ùå No Harry Schwarz content found in this file') except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH ANALYSIS SUMMARY') print('=' * 80) # Summarize all findings total_death_info = len(death_analysis['death_information']) total_obituary = len(death_analysis['obituary_content']) total_cause_of_death = len(death_analysis['cause_of_death']) total_potential_dates = len(death_analysis['potential_death_dates']) total_mentions = sum(mention['total_mentions'] for mention in death_analysis['harry_schwarz_mentions']) print(f'üìä COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Files analyzed: {death_analysis["files_analyzed"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total Harry Schwarz mentions: {total_mentions}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death information instances: {total_death_info}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Obituary content instances: {total_obituary}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Cause of death instances: {total_cause_of_death}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Potential death dates: {total_potential_dates}') # Show most significant death information if death_analysis['death_information']: print(f'\nüíÄ DEATH INFORMATION FOUND:') for i, info in enumerate(death_analysis['death_information'][:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Keyword: "{info["keyword"]}"') print(f' Sentence: {info["sentence"]}') # Show obituary content if death_analysis['obituary_content']: print(f'\nüì∞ OBITUARY CONTENT:') for i, content in enumerate(death_analysis['obituary_content'], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Source: {content["source_file"]}') print(f' Content: {content["sentence"]}') # Show cause of death information if death_analysis['cause_of_death']: print(f'\n‚öïÔ∏è CAUSE OF DEATH INFORMATION:') for i, cause in enumerate(death_analysis['cause_of_death'], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Source: {cause["source_file"]}') print(f' Content: {cause["sentence"]}') # Show potential death dates if death_analysis['potential_death_dates']: print(f'\nüìÖ POTENTIAL DEATH DATES:') # Sort by distance and group by date dates_by_distance = sorted(death_analysis['potential_death_dates'], key=lambda x: x['distance']) unique_dates = {} for date_info in dates_by_distance: date = date_info['date'] if date not in unique_dates or date_info['distance'] < unique_dates[date]['distance']: unique_dates[date] = date_info for i, (date, info) in enumerate(unique_dates.items(), 1): print(f'\n{i}. Date: {date} (closest match: {info["distance"]} chars from "{info["death_word"]}")') print(f' Context: {info["context"][:200]}...') print(f' Source: {info["source_file"]}') # Analyze years for death year patterns if death_analysis['year_mentions']: all_years = Counter(death_analysis['year_mentions']) print(f'\nüìÖ ALL YEARS MENTIONED:') for year, count in all_years.most_common(15): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {year}: {count} mentions') # Focus on likely death years (2000-2025) recent_years = {year: count for year, count in all_years.items() if 2000 <= int(year) <= 2025} if recent_years: print(f'\nüéØ LIKELY DEATH YEARS (2000-2025):') for year, count in sorted(recent_years.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {year}: {count} mentions') # Final conclusion print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('FINAL CONCLUSION ON HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH INFORMATION') print('=' * 80) confidence_score = 0 if total_mentions > 50: confidence_score += 20 if total_death_info > 0: confidence_score += 30 if total_obituary > 0: confidence_score += 25 if total_cause_of_death > 0: confidence_score += 15 if total_potential_dates > 0: confidence_score += 10 print(f'üìà CONFIDENCE SCORE: {confidence_score}/100') if confidence_score >= 70: print('‚úÖ HIGH CONFIDENCE - Comprehensive death information found') if death_analysis['potential_death_dates']: best_date = sorted(death_analysis['potential_death_dates'], key=lambda x: x['distance'])[0] print(f' Most likely death date: {best_date["date"]}') if death_analysis['cause_of_death']: print(' Cause of death information available') if death_analysis['obituary_content']: print(' Obituary content identified') elif confidence_score >= 40: print('‚ö†Ô∏è MODERATE CONFIDENCE - Some death information found') if death_analysis['death_information']: print(f' Found {total_death_info} death-related mentions') if death_analysis['year_mentions']: years = Counter(death_analysis['year_mentions']) most_common_year = years.most_common(1)[0] print(f' Most mentioned year: {most_common_year[0]} ({most_common_year[1]} times)') elif total_mentions > 0: print('üìã LIMITED INFORMATION - Harry Schwarz content found but minimal death details') print(f' Total mentions: {total_mentions}') print(' Recommend searching additional sources or archives') else: print('‚ùå NO INFORMATION - No Harry Schwarz content found in search results') print(' Recommend trying different search terms or sources') # Save comprehensive death analysis results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'harry_schwarz_death_analysis.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(death_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE DEATH ANALYSIS SAVED TO: harry_schwarz_death_analysis.json') # Provide specific answers to the PLAN questions print(f'\nüéØ ANSWERS TO PLAN OBJECTIVES:') print('=' * 50) if death_analysis['potential_death_dates']: best_date = sorted(death_analysis['potential_death_dates'], key=lambda x: x['distance'])[0] print(f'DEATH DATE: {best_date["date"]} (based on contextual analysis)') elif death_analysis['year_mentions']: years = Counter(death_analysis['year_mentions']) most_common = years.most_common(1)[0] print(f'LIKELY DEATH YEAR: {most_common[0]} (mentioned {most_common[1]} times)') else: print('DEATH DATE: Not clearly identified in search results') if death_analysis['cause_of_death']: print(f'CAUSE OF DEATH: Information found - see detailed analysis above') else: print('CAUSE OF DEATH: Not identified in search results') if death_analysis['obituary_content']: print(f'OBITUARY: Content found - see detailed analysis above') else: print('OBITUARY: Not found in search results') print(f'\nSOURCE RELIABILITY: Based on {len([f for f in death_analysis["harry_schwarz_mentions"] if f["total_mentions"] > 0])} files with Harry Schwarz content') print('\n=== HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output
Code Output: === HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH INFORMATION ANALYSIS === Analyzing search results to extract death date, obituary, and cause of death Target: Harry Schwarz - South African politician and ambassador to France Found 8 HTML files and 2 JSON files: HTML 1. harry_schwarz_search_05_Harry_Schwarz_death_date_cause.html HTML 2. harry_schwarz_search_04_Harry_Schwarz_obituary_South_A.html HTML 3. harry_schwarz_search_01_Harry_Schwarz_South_Africa_dea.html HTML 4. harry_schwarz_search_03_Harry_Schwarz_ambassador_Franc.html HTML 5. harry_schwarz_search_08_Harry_Schwarz_death_2010_cause.html HTML 6. harry_schwarz_search_06_Harry_Schwarz_Inkatha_Freedom_.html HTML 7. harry_schwarz_search_07_Harry_Schwarz_South_African_am.html HTML 8. harry_schwarz_search_02_Harry_Schwarz_Progressive_Fede.html JSON 1. harry_schwarz_detailed_research.json JSON 2. harry_schwarz_death_search_results.json üìã INSPECTING JSON SUMMARY FILE: harry_schwarz_detailed_research.json ------------------------------------------------------------ JSON file structure: ‚Ä¢ research_date: <class 'str'> ‚Ä¢ focus: <class 'str'> ‚Ä¢ candidate_profile: <class 'dict'> ‚Ä¢ analysis: <class 'dict'> ‚Ä¢ french_ambassador_analysis: <class 'dict'> ‚Ä¢ final_assessment: <class 'dict'> ‚Ä¢ next_research_steps: <class 'list'> Length: 6 ‚Ä¢ conclusion: <class 'str'> JSON summary: Target person: Not found Objective: Not found Total queries: 0 Results collected: 0 üìÅ ANALYZING 8 HTML FILES FOR HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH INFORMATION: ================================================================================ Analysis order (priority files first): 2 priority, 6 others üéØ PRIORITY - Analyzing File 1: harry_schwarz_search_01_Harry_Schwarz_South_Africa_dea.html ---------------------------------------------------------------------- HTML file size: 40,409 characters Extracted text size: 4,726 characters Harry Schwarz mentions: {'harry schwarz': 17, 'schwarz': 37, 'progressive federal party': 0, 'progressive party': 0, 'ambassador': 3, 'south africa': 21} (Total: 78) ‚úÖ Harry Schwarz content found in this file Error analyzing harry_schwarz_search_01_Harry_Schwarz_South_Africa_dea.html: name 'sentence_lower' is not defined üéØ PRIORITY - Analyzing File 2: harry_schwarz_search_02_Harry_Schwarz_Progressive_Fede.html ---------------------------------------------------------------------- HTML file size: 30,179 characters Extracted text size: 4,802 characters Harry Schwarz mentions: {'harry schwarz': 13, 'schwarz': 35, 'progressive federal party': 3, 'progressive party': 0, 'ambassador': 5, 'south africa': 19} (Total: 75) ‚úÖ Harry Schwarz content found in this file Error analyzing harry_schwarz_search_02_Harry_Schwarz_Progressive_Fede.html: name 'sentence_lower' is not defined üìÑ STANDARD - Analyzing File 4: harry_schwarz_search_04_Harry_Schwarz_obituary_South_A.html ---------------------------------------------------------------------- HTML file size: 14,300 characters Extracted text size: 311 characters Harry Schwarz mentions: {'harry schwarz': 0, 'schwarz': 0, 'progressive federal party': 0, 'progressive party': 0, 'ambassador': 0, 'south africa': 0} (Total: 0) ‚ùå No Harry Schwarz content found in this file üìÑ STANDARD - Analyzing File 8: harry_schwarz_search_07_Harry_Schwarz_South_African_am.html ---------------------------------------------------------------------- HTML file size: 14,318 characters Extracted text size: 311 characters Harry Schwarz mentions: {'harry schwarz': 0, 'schwarz': 0, 'progressive federal party': 0, 'progressive party': 0, 'ambassador': 0, 'south africa': 0} (Total: 0) ‚ùå No Harry Schwarz content found in this file ================================================================================ COMPREHENSIVE HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH ANALYSIS SUMMARY ================================================================================ üìä COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY: ‚Ä¢ Files analyzed: 8 ‚Ä¢ Total Harry Schwarz mentions: 0 ‚Ä¢ Death information instances: 0 ‚Ä¢ Obituary content instances: 0 ‚Ä¢ Cause of death instances: 0 ‚Ä¢ Potential death dates: 0 ================================================================================ FINAL CONCLUSION ON HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH INFORMATION ================================================================================ üìà CONFIDENCE SCORE: 0/100 ‚ùå NO INFORMATION - Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution partially successful - Code ran without errors and completed the HTML file analysis, but encountered a critical bug that prevented extraction of death information. The script successfully identified 2 priority files with significant Harry Schwarz content (78 and 75 mentions respectively) and detected death-related keywords, but failed during sentence analysis due to an undefined variable error ('sentence_lower' not defined). This bug prevented the extraction of specific death dates, obituary content, and cause of death information that the code was designed to find. The remaining 6 files contained no Harry Schwarz content (likely due to search engine rate limiting from the previous step). PLAN alignment: 30% complete - file analysis framework works, but the core death information extraction failed due to the coding error. Immediate fix needed: Correct the variable name error in the sentence analysis loop (line appears to reference 'sentence_lower' instead of 'sentence_data['text_lower']'). Once fixed, re-run to extract the actual death information from the two promising HTML files that contain Harry Schwarz biographical content.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from collections import Counter print('=== HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH INFORMATION ANALYSIS ===') print('Analyzing search results to extract death date, obituary, and cause of death') print('Target: Harry Schwarz - South African politician and ambassador to France\n') # First, inspect the workspace directory and available files workspace_dir = 'workspace' html_files = [] json_files = [] if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): if filename.endswith('.html') and 'harry_schwarz' in filename: html_files.append(filename) elif filename.endswith('.json') and 'harry_schwarz' in filename: json_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(html_files)} HTML files and {len(json_files)} JSON files:') for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): print(f' HTML {i}. {filename}') for i, filename in enumerate(json_files, 1): print(f' JSON {i}. {filename}') else: print('‚ùå Workspace directory not found') html_files = [] json_files = [] # First, inspect the JSON summary file structure if it exists if json_files: json_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, json_files[0]) print(f'\nüìã INSPECTING JSON SUMMARY FILE: {json_files[0]}') print('-' * 60) try: with open(json_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: json_data = json.load(f) print('JSON file structure:') for key in json_data.keys(): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {key}: {type(json_data[key])}') if isinstance(json_data[key], list): print(f' Length: {len(json_data[key])}') if len(json_data[key]) > 0 and isinstance(json_data[key][0], dict): print(f' Sample keys: {list(json_data[key][0].keys())}') print(f'\nJSON summary:') print(f' Target person: {json_data.get("target_person", "Not found")}') print(f' Objective: {json_data.get("objective", "Not found")}') print(f' Total queries: {len(json_data.get("search_queries", []))}') print(f' Results collected: {len(json_data.get("results_collected", []))}') # Show most promising results from JSON if 'results_collected' in json_data: promising_results = [r for r in json_data['results_collected'] if r.get('total_mentions', 0) > 0] print(f' Promising results: {len(promising_results)}') for result in promising_results[:2]: print(f' ‚Ä¢ Query: {result.get("query", "Unknown")}') print(f' Mentions: {result.get("total_mentions", 0)}') print(f' Death mentions: {result.get("death_mentions", {})}') print(f' File: {result.get("filename", "Unknown")}') except Exception as e: print(f'Error reading JSON file: {str(e)}') # Now analyze the HTML files for detailed death information if not html_files: print('‚ùå No HTML search result files found to analyze') else: print(f'\nüìÅ ANALYZING {len(html_files)} HTML FILES FOR HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH INFORMATION:') print('=' * 80) # Initialize detailed analysis results death_analysis = { 'timestamp': '2025-01-07', 'files_analyzed': len(html_files), 'harry_schwarz_mentions': [], 'death_information': [], 'obituary_content': [], 'biographical_data': [], 'year_mentions': [], 'potential_death_dates': [], 'cause_of_death': [] } # Focus on the two most promising files first (based on tester feedback) priority_files = [f for f in html_files if 'search_01' in f or 'search_02' in f] other_files = [f for f in html_files if f not in priority_files] analysis_order = priority_files + other_files print(f'Analysis order (priority files first): {len(priority_files)} priority, {len(other_files)} others') # Analyze each HTML file for i, filename in enumerate(analysis_order, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) is_priority = filename in priority_files priority_marker = 'üéØ PRIORITY' if is_priority else 'üìÑ STANDARD' print(f'\n{priority_marker} - Analyzing File {i}: {filename}') print('-' * 70) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() # Parse HTML with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Extract all text content page_text = soup.get_text(separator=' ', strip=True) page_text_lower = page_text.lower() print(f'HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters') print(f'Extracted text size: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Look for Harry Schwarz mentions harry_schwarz_indicators = { 'harry schwarz': page_text_lower.count('harry schwarz'), 'schwarz': page_text_lower.count('schwarz'), 'progressive federal party': page_text_lower.count('progressive federal party'), 'progressive party': page_text_lower.count('progressive party'), 'ambassador': page_text_lower.count('ambassador'), 'south africa': page_text_lower.count('south africa') } total_mentions = sum(harry_schwarz_indicators.values()) print(f'Harry Schwarz mentions: {harry_schwarz_indicators} (Total: {total_mentions})') if total_mentions > 0: print('‚úÖ Harry Schwarz content found in this file') # Split text into sentences for detailed analysis sentences = re.split(r'[.!?]', page_text) harry_schwarz_sentences = [] for sentence in sentences: if len(sentence.strip()) > 10: sentence_clean = sentence.strip() sentence_lower = sentence_clean.lower() # Check if this sentence mentions Harry Schwarz if 'harry schwarz' in sentence_lower or ('schwarz' in sentence_lower and any(term in sentence_lower for term in ['progressive', 'ambassador', 'south africa'])): harry_schwarz_sentences.append({ 'text': sentence_clean, 'text_lower': sentence_lower }) print(f'Sentences mentioning Harry Schwarz: {len(harry_schwarz_sentences)}') # Analyze for death information death_keywords = ['death', 'died', 'obituary', 'passed away', 'demise', 'deceased', 'funeral', 'burial', 'cause of death'] death_info_found = [] obituary_content = [] cause_of_death = [] for sentence_data in harry_schwarz_sentences: sentence_text = sentence_data['text'] sentence_lower = sentence_data['text_lower'] # Check for death keywords for keyword in death_keywords: if keyword in sentence_lower: death_info_found.append({ 'keyword': keyword, 'sentence': sentence_text[:400], 'context': 'harry_schwarz_sentence' }) # Special handling for obituary content if keyword == 'obituary': obituary_content.append({ 'sentence': sentence_text[:500], 'source_file': filename }) # Special handling for cause of death if 'cause' in sentence_lower and 'death' in sentence_lower: cause_of_death.append({ 'sentence': sentence_text[:500], 'source_file': filename }) break # Only count once per sentence # Look for specific death dates and years year_pattern = re.compile(r'\b(19\d{2}|20[0-2]\d)\b') years_found = year_pattern.findall(page_text) # Look for date patterns (day/month/year formats) date_patterns = [ r'\b(\d{1,2}[/-]\d{1,2}[/-]\d{4})\b', # DD/MM/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY r'\b(\d{1,2}\s+\w+\s+\d{4})\b', # DD Month YYYY r'\b(\w+\s+\d{1,2},?\s+\d{4})\b' # Month DD, YYYY ] potential_death_dates = [] for pattern in date_patterns: dates = re.findall(pattern, page_text) for date in dates: # Check if this date appears near death-related words for death_word in death_keywords[:5]: if death_word in page_text_lower: date_pos = page_text.find(date) death_positions = [m.start() for m in re.finditer(death_word, page_text_lower)] for death_pos in death_positions: distance = abs(date_pos - death_pos) if distance < 300: # Within 300 characters context_start = max(0, min(date_pos, death_pos) - 100) context_end = max(date_pos, death_pos) + 200 context = page_text[context_start:context_end] potential_death_dates.append({ 'date': date, 'death_word': death_word, 'distance': distance, 'context': context.strip(), 'source_file': filename }) # Report findings for this file if death_info_found: print(f'üíÄ Death information found: {len(death_info_found)} instances') for j, info in enumerate(death_info_found, 1): print(f' {j}. Keyword: "{info["keyword"]}"') print(f' Sentence: {info["sentence"]}...') death_analysis['death_information'].extend(death_info_found) else: print('‚ùì No death information found in Harry Schwarz sentences') if obituary_content: print(f'üì∞ Obituary content found: {len(obituary_content)} instances') for content in obituary_content: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {content["sentence"][:200]}...') death_analysis['obituary_content'].extend(obituary_content) if cause_of_death: print(f'‚öïÔ∏è Cause of death information: {len(cause_of_death)} instances') for cause in cause_of_death: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {cause["sentence"][:200]}...') death_analysis['cause_of_death'].extend(cause_of_death) if potential_death_dates: print(f'üìÖ Potential death dates found: {len(potential_death_dates)} instances') # Sort by distance (closer = more likely) potential_death_dates.sort(key=lambda x: x['distance']) for date_info in potential_death_dates[:3]: # Show top 3 print(f' ‚Ä¢ Date: {date_info["date"]} (near "{date_info["death_word"]}", distance: {date_info["distance"]} chars)') print(f' Context: {date_info["context"][:150]}...') death_analysis['potential_death_dates'].extend(potential_death_dates) if years_found: year_counts = Counter(years_found) print(f'üìÖ Years mentioned: {dict(year_counts.most_common(10))}') death_analysis['year_mentions'].extend(years_found) # Store file analysis info death_analysis['harry_schwarz_mentions'].append({ 'filename': filename, 'is_priority': is_priority, 'mentions': harry_schwarz_indicators, 'total_mentions': total_mentions, 'death_info_count': len(death_info_found), 'obituary_count': len(obituary_content), 'cause_of_death_count': len(cause_of_death), 'potential_dates_count': len(potential_death_dates), 'years_found': len(years_found), 'harry_schwarz_sentences': len(harry_schwarz_sentences) }) else: print('‚ùå No Harry Schwarz content found in this file') except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH ANALYSIS SUMMARY') print('=' * 80) # Summarize all findings total_death_info = len(death_analysis['death_information']) total_obituary = len(death_analysis['obituary_content']) total_cause_of_death = len(death_analysis['cause_of_death']) total_potential_dates = len(death_analysis['potential_death_dates']) total_mentions = sum(mention['total_mentions'] for mention in death_analysis['harry_schwarz_mentions']) print(f'üìä COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Files analyzed: {death_analysis["files_analyzed"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total Harry Schwarz mentions: {total_mentions}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death information instances: {total_death_info}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Obituary content instances: {total_obituary}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Cause of death instances: {total_cause_of_death}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Potential death dates: {total_potential_dates}') # Show most significant death information if death_analysis['death_information']: print(f'\nüíÄ DEATH INFORMATION FOUND:') for i, info in enumerate(death_analysis['death_information'][:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Keyword: "{info["keyword"]}"') print(f' Sentence: {info["sentence"]}') # Show obituary content if death_analysis['obituary_content']: print(f'\nüì∞ OBITUARY CONTENT:') for i, content in enumerate(death_analysis['obituary_content'], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Source: {content["source_file"]}') print(f' Content: {content["sentence"]}') # Show cause of death information if death_analysis['cause_of_death']: print(f'\n‚öïÔ∏è CAUSE OF DEATH INFORMATION:') for i, cause in enumerate(death_analysis['cause_of_death'], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Source: {cause["source_file"]}') print(f' Content: {cause["sentence"]}') # Show potential death dates if death_analysis['potential_death_dates']: print(f'\nüìÖ POTENTIAL DEATH DATES:') # Sort by distance and group by date dates_by_distance = sorted(death_analysis['potential_death_dates'], key=lambda x: x['distance']) unique_dates = {} for date_info in dates_by_distance: date = date_info['date'] if date not in unique_dates or date_info['distance'] < unique_dates[date]['distance']: unique_dates[date] = date_info for i, (date, info) in enumerate(unique_dates.items(), 1): print(f'\n{i}. Date: {date} (closest match: {info["distance"]} chars from "{info["death_word"]}")') print(f' Context: {info["context"][:200]}...') print(f' Source: {info["source_file"]}') # Analyze years for death year patterns if death_analysis['year_mentions']: all_years = Counter(death_analysis['year_mentions']) print(f'\nüìÖ ALL YEARS MENTIONED:') for year, count in all_years.most_common(15): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {year}: {count} mentions') # Focus on likely death years (2000-2025) recent_years = {year: count for year, count in all_years.items() if 2000 <= int(year) <= 2025} if recent_years: print(f'\nüéØ LIKELY DEATH YEARS (2000-2025):') for year, count in sorted(recent_years.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {year}: {count} mentions') # Final conclusion print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('FINAL CONCLUSION ON HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH INFORMATION') print('=' * 80) confidence_score = 0 if total_mentions > 50: confidence_score += 20 if total_death_info > 0: confidence_score += 30 if total_obituary > 0: confidence_score += 25 if total_cause_of_death > 0: confidence_score += 15 if total_potential_dates > 0: confidence_score += 10 print(f'üìà CONFIDENCE SCORE: {confidence_score}/100') if confidence_score >= 70: print('‚úÖ HIGH CONFIDENCE - Comprehensive death information found') if death_analysis['potential_death_dates']: best_date = sorted(death_analysis['potential_death_dates'], key=lambda x: x['distance'])[0] print(f' Most likely death date: {best_date["date"]}') if death_analysis['cause_of_death']: print(' Cause of death information available') if death_analysis['obituary_content']: print(' Obituary content identified') elif confidence_score >= 40: print('‚ö†Ô∏è MODERATE CONFIDENCE - Some death information found') if death_analysis['death_information']: print(f' Found {total_death_info} death-related mentions') if death_analysis['year_mentions']: years = Counter(death_analysis['year_mentions']) most_common_year = years.most_common(1)[0] print(f' Most mentioned year: {most_common_year[0]} ({most_common_year[1]} times)') elif total_mentions > 0: print('üìã LIMITED INFORMATION - Harry Schwarz content found but minimal death details') print(f' Total mentions: {total_mentions}') print(' Recommend searching additional sources or archives') else: print('‚ùå NO INFORMATION - No Harry Schwarz content found in search results') print(' Recommend trying different search terms or sources') # Save comprehensive death analysis results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'harry_schwarz_death_analysis.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(death_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE DEATH ANALYSIS SAVED TO: harry_schwarz_death_analysis.json') # Provide specific answers to the PLAN questions print(f'\nüéØ ANSWERS TO PLAN OBJECTIVES:') print('=' * 50) if death_analysis['potential_death_dates']: best_date = sorted(death_analysis['potential_death_dates'], key=lambda x: x['distance'])[0] print(f'DEATH DATE: {best_date["date"]} (based on contextual analysis)') elif death_analysis['year_mentions']: years = Counter(death_analysis['year_mentions']) most_common = years.most_common(1)[0] print(f'LIKELY DEATH YEAR: {most_common[0]} (mentioned {most_common[1]} times)') else: print('DEATH DATE: Not clearly identified in search results') if death_analysis['cause_of_death']: print(f'CAUSE OF DEATH: Information found - see detailed analysis above') else: print('CAUSE OF DEATH: Not identified in search results') if death_analysis['obituary_content']: print(f'OBITUARY: Content found - see detailed analysis above') else: print('OBITUARY: Not found in search results') print(f'\nSOURCE RELIABILITY: Based on {len([f for f in death_analysis["harry_schwarz_mentions"] if f["total_mentions"] > 0])} files with Harry Schwarz content') print('\n=== HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')

Code Execution - Plan #4 (Iteration 3)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from collections import Counter print('=== HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH INFORMATION ANALYSIS - FIXED VERSION ===') print('Correcting variable scoping error and extracting death information') print('Target: Harry Schwarz - South African politician and ambassador to France\n') # First, inspect the workspace directory and available files workspace_dir = 'workspace' html_files = [] json_files = [] if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): if filename.endswith('.html') and 'harry_schwarz' in filename: html_files.append(filename) elif filename.endswith('.json') and 'harry_schwarz' in filename: json_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(html_files)} HTML files and {len(json_files)} JSON files:') for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): print(f' HTML {i}. {filename}') for i, filename in enumerate(json_files, 1): print(f' JSON {i}. {filename}') else: print('‚ùå Workspace directory not found') html_files = [] json_files = [] # Focus on the two most promising files (based on tester feedback) priority_files = [f for f in html_files if 'search_01' in f or 'search_02' in f] other_files = [f for f in html_files if f not in priority_files] analysis_order = priority_files + other_files print(f'\nPriority analysis: {len(priority_files)} priority files, {len(other_files)} others') for i, filename in enumerate(priority_files, 1): print(f' Priority {i}: {filename}') if not html_files: print('‚ùå No HTML search result files found to analyze') else: print(f'\nüìÅ ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH INFORMATION:') print('=' * 80) # Initialize detailed analysis results death_analysis = { 'timestamp': '2025-01-07', 'files_analyzed': len(html_files), 'harry_schwarz_mentions': [], 'death_information': [], 'obituary_content': [], 'biographical_data': [], 'year_mentions': [], 'potential_death_dates': [], 'cause_of_death': [] } # Analyze each HTML file (focus on priority files first) for i, filename in enumerate(analysis_order, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) is_priority = filename in priority_files priority_marker = 'üéØ PRIORITY' if is_priority else 'üìÑ STANDARD' print(f'\n{priority_marker} - Analyzing File {i}: {filename}') print('-' * 70) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() # Parse HTML with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Extract all text content page_text = soup.get_text(separator=' ', strip=True) page_text_lower = page_text.lower() print(f'HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters') print(f'Extracted text size: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Look for Harry Schwarz mentions harry_schwarz_indicators = { 'harry schwarz': page_text_lower.count('harry schwarz'), 'schwarz': page_text_lower.count('schwarz'), 'progressive federal party': page_text_lower.count('progressive federal party'), 'progressive party': page_text_lower.count('progressive party'), 'ambassador': page_text_lower.count('ambassador'), 'south africa': page_text_lower.count('south africa') } total_mentions = sum(harry_schwarz_indicators.values()) print(f'Harry Schwarz mentions: {harry_schwarz_indicators} (Total: {total_mentions})') if total_mentions > 0: print('‚úÖ Harry Schwarz content found in this file') # FIXED: Split text into sentences and properly define variables sentences = re.split(r'[.!?]', page_text) harry_schwarz_sentences = [] print(f'Total sentences in file: {len(sentences)}') # Process each sentence to find Harry Schwarz mentions for sentence in sentences: if len(sentence.strip()) > 10: sentence_clean = sentence.strip() sentence_lower = sentence_clean.lower() # FIXED: Define here for each sentence # Check if this sentence mentions Harry Schwarz if ('harry schwarz' in sentence_lower or ('schwarz' in sentence_lower and any(term in sentence_lower for term in ['progressive', 'ambassador', 'south africa', 'politician']))): harry_schwarz_sentences.append({ 'text': sentence_clean, 'text_lower': sentence_lower }) print(f'Sentences mentioning Harry Schwarz: {len(harry_schwarz_sentences)}') # Show sample sentences for verification if harry_schwarz_sentences: print('Sample Harry Schwarz sentences:') for j, sent in enumerate(harry_schwarz_sentences[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. {sent["text"][:150]}...') # FIXED: Analyze for death information with proper variable handling death_keywords = ['death', 'died', 'obituary', 'passed away', 'demise', 'deceased', 'funeral', 'burial', 'cause of death'] death_info_found = [] obituary_content = [] cause_of_death = [] biographical_info = [] for sentence_data in harry_schwarz_sentences: sentence_text = sentence_data['text'] sentence_lower = sentence_data['text_lower'] # FIXED: Use from dictionary # Check for death keywords for keyword in death_keywords: if keyword in sentence_lower: death_info_found.append({ 'keyword': keyword, 'sentence': sentence_text[:400], 'context': 'harry_schwarz_sentence', 'source_file': filename }) # Special handling for obituary content if keyword == 'obituary': obituary_content.append({ 'sentence': sentence_text[:500], 'source_file': filename }) # Special handling for cause of death if 'cause' in sentence_lower and 'death' in sentence_lower: cause_of_death.append({ 'sentence': sentence_text[:500], 'source_file': filename }) break # Only count once per sentence # Look for biographical information bio_keywords = ['born', 'birth', 'career', 'politician', 'lawyer', 'ambassador', 'party'] for bio_keyword in bio_keywords: if bio_keyword in sentence_lower and len(sentence_text.strip()) > 20: biographical_info.append({ 'keyword': bio_keyword, 'sentence': sentence_text[:300], 'source_file': filename }) break # Look for specific death dates and years year_pattern = re.compile(r'\b(19\d{2}|20[0-2]\d)\b') years_found = year_pattern.findall(page_text) # Look for date patterns (day/month/year formats) date_patterns = [ r'\b(\d{1,2}[/-]\d{1,2}[/-]\d{4})\b', # DD/MM/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY r'\b(\d{1,2}\s+\w+\s+\d{4})\b', # DD Month YYYY r'\b(\w+\s+\d{1,2},?\s+\d{4})\b' # Month DD, YYYY ] potential_death_dates = [] for pattern in date_patterns: dates = re.findall(pattern, page_text) for date in dates: # Check if this date appears near death-related words for death_word in death_keywords[:5]: if death_word in page_text_lower: date_pos = page_text.find(date) death_positions = [m.start() for m in re.finditer(death_word, page_text_lower)] for death_pos in death_positions: distance = abs(date_pos - death_pos) if distance < 300: # Within 300 characters context_start = max(0, min(date_pos, death_pos) - 100) context_end = max(date_pos, death_pos) + 200 context = page_text[context_start:context_end] potential_death_dates.append({ 'date': date, 'death_word': death_word, 'distance': distance, 'context': context.strip(), 'source_file': filename }) # Report findings for this file if death_info_found: print(f'üíÄ Death information found: {len(death_info_found)} instances') for j, info in enumerate(death_info_found, 1): print(f' {j}. Keyword: "{info["keyword"]}"') print(f' Sentence: {info["sentence"]}...') death_analysis['death_information'].extend(death_info_found) else: print('‚ùì No death information found in Harry Schwarz sentences') if obituary_content: print(f'üì∞ Obituary content found: {len(obituary_content)} instances') for content in obituary_content: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {content["sentence"][:200]}...') death_analysis['obituary_content'].extend(obituary_content) if cause_of_death: print(f'‚öïÔ∏è Cause of death information: {len(cause_of_death)} instances') for cause in cause_of_death: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {cause["sentence"][:200]}...') death_analysis['cause_of_death'].extend(cause_of_death) if biographical_info: print(f'üìñ Biographical information found: {len(biographical_info)} instances') for bio in biographical_info[:3]: # Show first 3 print(f' ‚Ä¢ {bio["keyword"]}: {bio["sentence"][:150]}...') death_analysis['biographical_data'].extend(biographical_info) if potential_death_dates: print(f'üìÖ Potential death dates found: {len(potential_death_dates)} instances') # Sort by distance (closer = more likely) potential_death_dates.sort(key=lambda x: x['distance']) for date_info in potential_death_dates[:3]: # Show top 3 print(f' ‚Ä¢ Date: {date_info["date"]} (near "{date_info["death_word"]}", distance: {date_info["distance"]} chars)') print(f' Context: {date_info["context"][:150]}...') death_analysis['potential_death_dates'].extend(potential_death_dates) if years_found: year_counts = Counter(years_found) print(f'üìÖ Years mentioned: {dict(year_counts.most_common(10))}') death_analysis['year_mentions'].extend(years_found) else: print('‚ùì No years found in this file') # Store file analysis info death_analysis['harry_schwarz_mentions'].append({ 'filename': filename, 'is_priority': is_priority, 'mentions': harry_schwarz_indicators, 'total_mentions': total_mentions, 'death_info_count': len(death_info_found), 'obituary_count': len(obituary_content), 'cause_of_death_count': len(cause_of_death), 'biographical_count': len(biographical_info), 'potential_dates_count': len(potential_death_dates), 'years_found': len(years_found), 'harry_schwarz_sentences': len(harry_schwarz_sentences) }) else: print('‚ùå No Harry Schwarz content found in this file') except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH ANALYSIS SUMMARY') print('=' * 80) # Summarize all findings total_death_info = len(death_analysis['death_information']) total_obituary = len(death_analysis['obituary_content']) total_cause_of_death = len(death_analysis['cause_of_death']) total_potential_dates = len(death_analysis['potential_death_dates']) total_biographical = len(death_analysis['biographical_data']) total_mentions = sum(mention['total_mentions'] for mention in death_analysis['harry_schwarz_mentions']) print(f'üìä COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Files analyzed: {death_analysis["files_analyzed"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total Harry Schwarz mentions: {total_mentions}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death information instances: {total_death_info}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Obituary content instances: {total_obituary}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Cause of death instances: {total_cause_of_death}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Biographical information instances: {total_biographical}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Potential death dates: {total_potential_dates}') # Show most significant death information if death_analysis['death_information']: print(f'\nüíÄ DEATH INFORMATION FOUND:') for i, info in enumerate(death_analysis['death_information'][:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Keyword: "{info["keyword"]}" (Source: {info["source_file"]})') print(f' Sentence: {info["sentence"]}') else: print(f'\n‚ùì No death information found in Harry Schwarz content') # Show obituary content if death_analysis['obituary_content']: print(f'\nüì∞ OBITUARY CONTENT:') for i, content in enumerate(death_analysis['obituary_content'], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Source: {content["source_file"]}') print(f' Content: {content["sentence"]}') else: print(f'\n‚ùì No obituary content found') # Show cause of death information if death_analysis['cause_of_death']: print(f'\n‚öïÔ∏è CAUSE OF DEATH INFORMATION:') for i, cause in enumerate(death_analysis['cause_of_death'], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Source: {cause["source_file"]}') print(f' Content: {cause["sentence"]}') else: print(f'\n‚ùì No cause of death information found') # Show potential death dates if death_analysis['potential_death_dates']: print(f'\nüìÖ POTENTIAL DEATH DATES:') # Sort by distance and group by date dates_by_distance = sorted(death_analysis['potential_death_dates'], key=lambda x: x['distance']) unique_dates = {} for date_info in dates_by_distance: date = date_info['date'] if date not in unique_dates or date_info['distance'] < unique_dates[date]['distance']: unique_dates[date] = date_info for i, (date, info) in enumerate(unique_dates.items(), 1): print(f'\n{i}. Date: {date} (closest match: {info["distance"]} chars from "{info["death_word"]}")') print(f' Context: {info["context"][:200]}...') print(f' Source: {info["source_file"]}') else: print(f'\n‚ùì No potential death dates found') # Show biographical information if death_analysis['biographical_data']: print(f'\nüìñ BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION:') for i, bio in enumerate(death_analysis['biographical_data'][:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Keyword: "{bio["keyword"]}" (Source: {bio["source_file"]})') print(f' Content: {bio["sentence"]}') else: print(f'\n‚ùì No biographical information found') # Analyze years for death year patterns if death_analysis['year_mentions']: all_years = Counter(death_analysis['year_mentions']) print(f'\nüìÖ ALL YEARS MENTIONED:') for year, count in all_years.most_common(15): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {year}: {count} mentions') # Focus on likely death years (2000-2025) recent_years = {year: count for year, count in all_years.items() if 2000 <= int(year) <= 2025} if recent_years: print(f'\nüéØ LIKELY DEATH YEARS (2000-2025):') for year, count in sorted(recent_years.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {year}: {count} mentions') # Special focus on 2010 (mentioned in PLAN) if year == '2010': print(f' ‚≠ê 2010 is specifically mentioned in the PLAN as a potential death year') else: print(f'\n‚ùì No years found in content') # Final conclusion print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('FINAL CONCLUSION ON HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH INFORMATION') print('=' * 80) confidence_score = 0 if total_mentions > 50: confidence_score += 20 if total_death_info > 0: confidence_score += 30 if total_obituary > 0: confidence_score += 25 if total_cause_of_death > 0: confidence_score += 15 if total_potential_dates > 0: confidence_score += 10 print(f'üìà CONFIDENCE SCORE: {confidence_score}/100') if confidence_score >= 70: print('‚úÖ HIGH CONFIDENCE - Comprehensive death information found') if death_analysis['potential_death_dates']: best_date = sorted(death_analysis['potential_death_dates'], key=lambda x: x['distance'])[0] print(f' Most likely death date: {best_date["date"]}') if death_analysis['cause_of_death']: print(' Cause of death information available') if death_analysis['obituary_content']: print(' Obituary content identified') elif confidence_score >= 40: print('‚ö†Ô∏è MODERATE CONFIDENCE - Some death information found') if death_analysis['death_information']: print(f' Found {total_death_info} death-related mentions') if death_analysis['year_mentions']: years = Counter(death_analysis['year_mentions']) most_common_year = years.most_common(1)[0] print(f' Most mentioned year: {most_common_year[0]} ({most_common_year[1]} times)') elif total_mentions > 0: print('üìã LIMITED INFORMATION - Harry Schwarz content found but minimal death details') print(f' Total mentions: {total_mentions}') if death_analysis['year_mentions']: years = Counter(death_analysis['year_mentions']) most_common_year = years.most_common(1)[0] print(f' Most mentioned year: {most_common_year[0]} ({most_common_year[1]} times)') if most_common_year[0] == '2010': print(' ‚≠ê 2010 aligns with PLAN expectation - likely death year') print(' Recommend searching additional sources or archives for specific death details') else: print('‚ùå NO INFORMATION - No Harry Schwarz content found in search results') print(' Recommend trying different search terms or sources') # Save comprehensive death analysis results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'harry_schwarz_death_analysis_fixed.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(death_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE DEATH ANALYSIS SAVED TO: harry_schwarz_death_analysis_fixed.json') # Provide specific answers to the PLAN questions print(f'\nüéØ ANSWERS TO PLAN OBJECTIVES:') print('=' * 50) if death_analysis['potential_death_dates']: best_date = sorted(death_analysis['potential_death_dates'], key=lambda x: x['distance'])[0] print(f'DEATH DATE: {best_date["date"]} (based on contextual analysis)') print(f'CONFIDENCE: High - found within {best_date["distance"]} characters of death-related terms') elif death_analysis['year_mentions']: years = Counter(death_analysis['year_mentions']) most_common = years.most_common(1)[0] print(f'LIKELY DEATH YEAR: {most_common[0]} (mentioned {most_common[1]} times)') if most_common[0] == '2010': print('CONFIDENCE: Moderate-High - aligns with PLAN expectation') else: print('CONFIDENCE: Moderate - based on frequency analysis') else: print('DEATH DATE: Not clearly identified in search results') print('CONFIDENCE: Low - insufficient data') if death_analysis['cause_of_death']: print(f'\nCAUSE OF DEATH: Information found in {len(death_analysis["cause_of_death"])} instances') print('CONFIDENCE: Moderate - specific cause of death content identified') else: print('\nCAUSE OF DEATH: Not identified in search results') print('CONFIDENCE: Low - no specific cause of death information found') if death_analysis['obituary_content']: print(f'\nOBITUARY: Content found in {len(death_analysis["obituary_content"])} instances') print('CONFIDENCE: Moderate - obituary content identified') else: print('\nOBITUARY: Not found in search results') print('CONFIDENCE: Low - no obituary content identified') print(f'\nSOURCE RELIABILITY: Based on {len([f for f in death_analysis["harry_schwarz_mentions"] if f["total_mentions"] > 0])} files with Harry Schwarz content') if total_mentions > 100: print('SOURCE QUALITY: High - extensive Harry Schwarz content found') elif total_mentions > 50: print('SOURCE QUALITY: Moderate - significant Harry Schwarz content found') else: print('SOURCE QUALITY: Limited - minimal Harry Schwarz content found') print('\n=== HARRY SCHWARZ DEATH ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output
